channel.title: Changeing npc names
channel.description:
ok im wanting to change the name of my npc ingame if anyone knows how to do this and can help me id enjoy it
-pure m e r k

item.title: Changeing npc names
item.dc:creator: @Bill1 Bill_
item.description:
@Bill1 wrote:

3lv3n snip3r:

what kind if server is it? 317? 474? 562? 614? if its 317, delta? PI? devo?

I just guessed it was 317

Read full topic

item.title: Changeing npc names
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

what kind if server is it? 317? 474? 562? 614? if its 317, delta? PI? devo?

It’s Client Sided

If it’s delta, go to class5 and under this method:

[code=text]public static final Class5 method159(int i)
{
for(int j = 0; j < 20; j++)
if(aClass5Array80[j].aLong78 == (long)i)
return aClass5Array80[j];

    anInt56 = (anInt56 + 1) % 20;
    Class5 class5 = aClass5Array80[anInt56] = new Class5();
    aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[i];
    class5.aLong78 = i;
    class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60);[/code]

Add this:

if(i == Npc id) { class5.aStringArray66[0] = "Talk-to"; //YOU CAN CHANGE THIS class5.aStringArray66[2] = "Trade"; //YOU CAN CHANGE THIS class5.aString65 = "Npc Name"; // Npc Name class5.anInt61 = 110; //combat level class5.aByteArray89 = "Npc description".getBytes(); // Examine Info }

You don’t need the “Talk-to” or “Trade” but, you can have it if you want it, your choice.
Most Npc’s already have a “Talk-to” button on it.
You can change the npc combat level as well but it isn’t needed

Read full topic

item.title: Changeing npc names
item.dc:creator: @Bill1 Bill_
item.description:
@Bill1 wrote:

Wrong section. But in response to your question - if it’s dialogue, it’s server sided (NPC.cgf), but if it’s the actual NPC’s name like talk to “HANS” then that’s client sided.

Read full topic
